note.p: Buried: St Giles' cemetery, now Ascension Cemetery, Cambridge

Career: Tutor to the sons of William Parsons, 3rd Earl of Rosse (FRS 1831) (1865-1867) owner of the six-foot relecting trelescope, then the largest in the world; Professor of Applied Mathematics and Mechanism, Royal College of Science, Dublin; Professor of Astronomy, University of Dublin (1874-1892); Astronomer Royal for Ireland; Lowndean Professor of Astronomy, Cambridge University (1893-1913); his eyesight failed and his right eye was removed (1887); Christmas lectures at the Royal Institution
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1914-1915 vol 91 pp xvii-xxi signed by F W D and G T B
